page.title: 01OUR D BLOCK
page.content: Our 'D' Block consists of two valleys mainly - Sheepscombe Valley and Cranham Valley and is on the west side of the Cotswolds. There are two streams which join and flow into the Severn. There are three villages and one hamlet. The villages are called Cranham, Sheepscombe and Whiteway. The hamlet is called Climperwell. The land in the valleys is mostly grazing for store and dairy cattle and an increasing number of sheep. On the higher,flatter parts intensive arable farming is the norm. Both Sheepscombe and Cranham have changed since 1945 into commuter villages with a resultant upgrading in the standard of housing. The two villages are favoured spots for picnics and country walks and the Cotswold Wayfeatures in the N-Wcorner of the block.
